Package com.intellij.openapi.progress

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.progress.Task
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Progressive, TaskInfo
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Task.Backgroundable, Task.Modal

    public abstract class Task
extends java.lang.Object
implements TaskInfo, Progressive
    Intended to run tasks, both modal and non-modal (backgroundable) Example of use: 
     new Task.Backgroundable(project, "Synchronizing data", true) {
  public void run(ProgressIndicator indicator) {
    indicator.setText("Loading changes");
    indicator.setIndeterminate(false);
    indicator.setFraction(0.0);
    // some code
    indicator.setFraction(1.0);
  }
 }.setCancelText("Stop loading").queue();
    See Also:
    ProgressManager.run(Task)

    • Method Detail

      • onCancel

        public void onCancel()
        This callback will be invoked on AWT dispatch thread. Callback executed when run() throws ProcessCanceledException or if its ProgressIndicator was canceled.

      • onSuccess

        public void onSuccess()
        This callback will be invoked on AWT dispatch thread.

      • onError

        @Deprecated
public void onError(java.lang.Exception error)
        Deprecated. use onThrowable(Throwable) instead
        This callback will be invoked on AWT dispatch thread.

        Callback executed when Progressive.run(ProgressIndicator) throws an exception (except ProcessCanceledException).

      • onThrowable

        public void onThrowable(java.lang.Throwable error)
        This callback will be invoked on AWT dispatch thread.

        Callback executed when Progressive.run(ProgressIndicator) throws an exception (except ProcessCanceledException).

      • onFinished

        public void onFinished()
        This callback will be invoked on AWT dispatch thread, after other specific handlers.

      • whereToRunCallbacks

        public EdtReplacementThread whereToRunCallbacks()
        Specifies the thread to run callbacks on. See EdtReplacementThread documentation for more info.
